job_description: On a project to modernize our stack, I led an initiative to enhance our telecom platform's performance and reliability. By implementing RAII patterns in C, we improved resource management, which significantly reduced memory leaks. Additionally, I developed shell tooling to automate deployment processes, resulting in a 30% decrease in deployment time. To optimize data retrieval, I introduced connection pooling, which improved database response times and reduced load on our servers. Furthermore, I tackled cache invalidation issues that had been causing stale data, leading to a noticeable increase in user satisfaction and fewer support tickets. This comprehensive approach not only streamlined our operations but also positioned us for future scalability, ensuring we could handle increased traffic without compromising service quality.
